direction.raw_text: . SOVIET LABOR CAMP 105, SIBERIA - NIGHT 2 Out of the blackness, the momentary glimpse of a barbed wire fence, lit by the combing fingers of a searchlight. Another angle, and the silhouette of distant timber buildings is briefly etched, before the light passes and all is again in darkness. Closer, on a canvas-sided barrack building - ghostly shadows projected on the wall. SUPER: 'SOVIET LABOR CAMP 105, SIBERIA, 1940'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARRACKS, CAMP 105, SIBERIA - NIGHT 3 A long rectangular building, the walls lined with two tiered bunks of rough-hewn logs. In the centre - a metal stove with a chimney stretching out through the roof. A dim central bulb illuminates some 150 men, aged from 16 to 60, most sitting or lying on their bunks. Some wear scraps of army uniform, or civilian clothing, others in prison issued padded jackets. Some, from the Asian territories, still ear something of their national costume. Included among them are groups of foreigners from recently occupied countries and a Babel of languages drifts through the fetid air. It's a wide ranging mix of types, of race, of class. They're miserable, starving and ill. There is no camp camaraderie and they eye each other with indifference or suspicion. Most of these men are political prisoners, known as 'Politicals' or 'S8ers', after the section of the Soviet Penal Code that has put them here. Near the stove, and contrasted with the 'Politicals', a group are gathered about a card game on a lower bunk. These men look healthier, and are further distinguished by their tattoos. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are the URKI, some dozen of them, regular criminals, and from their manner the undisputed masters of the block. Sitting facing each other - VALKA, thirties, heavily tattooed, flash of a steel-caped tooth. His opponent,

Moving quickly to complete a second deal, KHABAROV swaps half his share of the tobacco with another prisoner for two slices of bread. He waits until the last of the men leave then he carefully breaks off a corner from one piece of bread, concealing the rest in a hiding place in the dirt at the base of his bunk - a glimpse of a cache of hoarded food and other items.

direction.raw_text: . LABOR CAMP 105, SIBERIA - DAWN 7 The camp seen in a distant view - surrounded by double wire, a collection of weathered timber buildings with watchtowers placed at regular intervals along the perimeter. In the distance, dense forest. Entering frame a column of close to a hundred men march toward the camp. Following behind is a lorry, carrying six guards, supplies for their recent journey, and a camp stove.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: 'LABOR IS HONOR, GLORY, NOBILITY, AND HEROISM'

direction.raw_text: . CAMP GATES - DAWN 8 As they approach one of the prisoners looks up to an arch stretching across the gates - a hand-painted sign in Russian subtitled: 'LABOR IS HONOR, GLORY, NOBILITY, AND HEROISM'. The prisoner is JANUSZ, early twenties and he exchanges a look with the man beside him, TOMASZ, about the same age. ANOTHER ANGLE shows a line of prisoners, five abreast, marching toward them on their way to work. They have their attendant guards and dogs and as the two columns pass each other the contrast between the half-starved, ill looking 'old' prisoners and the comparative health of the 'new', could not be more apparent - 'Is this what we are to become?' on the faces of the 'new'. We glimpse some of those already established - they include BOHDAN, and VALKA, and further back - SMITH and KHABAROV. As they pass they look across to JANUSZ and TOMASZ, both Polish, and behind them to VOSS, a tall young Latvian with a mop of white-blonde hair. Behind VOSS - ZORAN, a blanket over his three-piece suit. Beside him, another Pole - KAZIK, at seventeen, the youngest in the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 'THE ZONE', CAMP 105 - DAY 9 The newly arrived prisoners assemble between the various buildings - an area known as the 'ZONE'. (CNNTTNTTFD ) Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 8.

direction.raw_text: The camp is being expanded, and everywhere are piles of cut timber, coils of wire, and work going on replacing old canvas-sided barracks with new timber ones. The Spring thaw has turned recently melted snow into slush, and duck-boards are hastily laid to allow the Commandant to cross to the assembled prisoners. He walks with his subordinate and LAZAR who is FOREMAN of the new camp construction. LAZAR carries a sheaf of plans, and the COMMANDANT stops, studies a drawing, then impatiently issues an order dismissing him. The COMMANDANT mounts a box, accepting a folder of documents from his subordinate, who has in turn received them from the escorting guard. The COMMANDANT surveys the prisoners before him. He's a man in his fifties with a bland but not unintelligent cast to his features. He looks up from the collection of documents in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enemies of the People! Look about you...and understand... it is not our guns, or our dogs, or our wire, that forms your prison. Siberia is your prison. All four million square miles of it. Here in Camp 105, you will work hard. Work and you eat. Eat and you live. Close on JANUSZ and his friends. Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 9.

direction.raw_text: - DAY AC 18 On the valley floor, below towering cliffs, some 150 men haul rocks in wooden wheelbarrows from the mine entrance across a maze of tracks to waiting trucks. A fire blazes in a 44 gallon drum set up in an open-sided wooden shelter. Here BOHDAN and his criminal associates supervise the work. VALKA has fallen on a slippery slope within the Urka hierarchy following his losses and growing debt. ( CC)NTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : AC18 BOHDAN amuses himself by throwing stones at VALKA, warning him away from the fire like a stray dog. Guards placed at vantage points, stamp their feet to keep warm, occasionally shouting at the exhausted prisoners to work harder or move faster. Death is casual here. A man falls. If found to be dead he is left where he fell, bodies to be collected and counted at the end of the day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MINE ENTRANCE - DAY AD18 JANUSZ and his group dump a load of trimmed logs in a bay by the mine entrance. He hesitates as the others move away, staring into the black hole leading into the mountain. Eerie sounds drift up from deep below. A look of utter dread on his face.

direction.raw_text: . CAMP PERIMETER - NIGHT 26 KHABAROV leads him toward the wire. From somewhere deep in the bowels of the earth, a low sinister rumbling, the very ground itself shaking momentarily. JANUSZ stops, while KHABAROV keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mines. They blast at night. He pauses to let JANUSZ catch up, then looking furtively about him, he crouches by a drift of snow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hands him his shirt. He scrapes a hole in the snow, buries the shirt, leaving only the tip showing. He does the same with his own shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to leave them here overnight? Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares up at the wire, then to a distant watchtower, its searchlight briefly illuminating him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: follows his eye-line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holding his breath. (CC)NTTNTTED ) Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 20.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a way through the wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lazar, you've seen him, my associate, overseer of construction. He nods toward an area where stockade wall is being replaced with double wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Few ever escape the camps. I've waited for someone like you, someone with the strength and will to see it through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't go West - apart from the Soviets, there's the Germans. East? All Soviet right to the Pacific.. .it would have to be South?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods, beams at him like a teacher with a very bright pupil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They marched as due North from the railway, I glimpsed a lake, but I have no idea where we are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: squats down, JANUSZ joins him, and smoothing out a drift of snow KHABAROV sketches a map of a lake and indicates the location of the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We believe about 500 kilometers north of Lake Baikal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could follow the edge of the Lake, it runs due South.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then on to the Trans-Siberian Railway. Cross that and you're close to the Mongolian border. And freedom. ( C.ONTTNTTFT) ) Revised 3/4/09 (Yellow) 21.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JANUSZ's eyes burn with excitement. KHABAROV takes his arm, as if drawing energy from the younger man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spring is already upon us. It would have to be next autumn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why wait?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's 1000 kilometers to the border, maybe more. We need careful planning, stock-pile food. I've already begun - trading, dealing. You could do the same. In the Autumn the weather is predictable. We need the early snows to cover our tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about my friends?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you trust them. But they won't all survive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But they'd die free men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: offers his hand, and they shake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARRACK - NIGHT A27 KHABAROV and JANUSZ enter, having buried the shirt in the snow. KHABAROV indicates LAZAR, sitting on a bunk , and whispers. KHABAROV That's Lazar. He was architect. In Kiev.Now he is grave robber - me too. (Whispers) We sneak out at night.Through the wire. He moves away. 27 EXT. CAMP - DAWN 27 To the echoing clang of the hammer and iron, JANUSZ and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hurry to where they buried their clothing. (CNNTTNTTRD ) Revised 3/4/09 (Yellow) 21A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CLOSE on the tips of the cloth showing above the snow - a teeming mound of lice on each.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R, as they shake their clothing free of the lice, and hurry over to join the assembly of prisoners at the kitchen servery window for their meagre breakfast ration. At the same time the morning ritual of carrying out the bodies of those who have died overnight is underway. The corpses are stacked like cords of wood for burial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pauses, a muttered prayer on his lips. Then he's passing the hospital barracks - the usual crowd of desperately ill prisoners hoping to be admitted, to be excused another day of the killing work, the majority turned away. He joins the line at the kitchen. The days' bread ration is being weighed and issued. If not exactly 500 grams a little is added or subtracted, the cook keeping trimmed slices, placing them in a tin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE ZONE/CAMP EXTERIOR - DAWN 28 Having been counted once, inside the camp, the brigade of prisoners is marched outside the gates where the armed guards who will escort them to work are waiting. GUARD NO. 1 begins counting them again. It's much colder than usual, prisoners beating their arms to keep warm, a high wind blowing. Khabarov stands with JANUSZ. KHABAROV Temperature is dropping. Below 60 they're not supposed to send us out. Know how to tell the temperature? You see frosty fog - it's 40 below. If you exhale easily but in a rasping fashion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: below. When your spit freezes? More than 60 below. He hoiks and spits. Close on the ball of spit mid-air. Freeze-frame. It's a solid glittering crystal of ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD THROUGH FOREST - DAY A30 The freezing wind has picked up considerably, driving sleet against the column of prisoners, forcing them to a halt in an open snow-covered area. The column halts, the guards anxiously confer - 'to go back or continue on'? The prisoners shiver in the biting cold, some collapse, their fellow prisoners unwilling or unable to help them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and his friends find themselves near SMITH and watch as he hails a GUARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Shouts in Russian) We need to make shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1 Who asked you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll freeze to death in less than an hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1 I couldn't give a fuck if you drop dead right now. (CNNTTNTTFT) ) Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 23.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A30 SMITH Yes, but lose 200 men and you'll have some forms to fill out. Could go badly for you. The GUARD dimly considers this. The prisoners begin to stir, some shouting out that they should turn back. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: alarmed, orders the prisoners to the ground - other guards level their rifles as the mass of men lay down on the freezing ground. All but SMITH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could move into the forest, find shelter!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1 Lie down! The GUARD is about to leave when to his astonishment, and that of the other prisoners, SMITH begins to walk toward the forest edging the road. The GUARD draws his pistol. On the ground ZORAN lies beside JANUSZ, as they watch the unfolding drama.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1 shouts for SMITH to return, others raise their rifles, waiting for his order to fire. He is conflicted, and after a tense moment gestures for them to lower their weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1 (CONT'D) Let the prisoners take shelter in the trees! Shoot anyone who makes a run for it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares after SMITH, admiring of his reckless courage. AB30 FOREST, LATER - DAY AB30 The men work frantically collecting fallen timber. SMITH watches as VOSS picks up a massive log, places it on his shoulder and carries it to where JANUSZ is supervising the building of their shelter. Most of the other prisoners have just piled snow up around bundles of sticks to make windbreaks, but JANUSZ is building something more elaborate. SMITH's eyes miss nothing as he notes JANUSZ's skill and the way the others work as a team under his direction. (C_NNTTNTTFT)1 Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 24.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : AB30 Some distance away VALKA huddles alone against the trunk of a tree. He too, is watching JANUSZ organize shelter for the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calls KHABAROV to join them, but he declines politely. He moves on to find SMITH - invites him back to their improvised shelter. As SMITH sits, ZORAN offers his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are brave man - Dragan Zoran, Yugoslav this is Janusz Wieszczek the youngster is Kazik, both Polish. (They nod to SMITH)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andrejs Voss, Latvian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (It's a League of Nations.) English our common language!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smith.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your first name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Smith?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. As the blizzard grows in intensity, JANUSZ reaches into his pocket for strips of pine-bark collected earlier. He hands them out to his companions. They watch as he chews on the bark. The others follow his example. Watching from a short distance away is GUARD NO. 1. He takes note of the group as future troublemakers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARRACKS - DAWN AD30 The men are stirring, struggling up to face another day, when the door opens, and in a flurry of snow, GUARD NO. 1 enters with another soldier. He orders SMITH, JANUSZ and his group to fall out. As he passes SMITH - GUARD NO. 1 (IN RUSSIAN) You don't like being out in the cold, do you Cowboy? And as he moves away SMITH mutters to JANUSZ. SMITH Might as well have shot us yesterday. JANUSZ and the others look at him. SMITH (CONT'D) We're for the mine. 30 INT. MINE - DAY 30 A labyrinth of twisting tunnels leading down into the frozen earth. Dim lights silhouette ghostly figures working with pick and shovel. Occasionally the muffled sound of a distant explosion as a gallery is blasted yet deeper. Mingling with these eerie sounds something more sinister - the hacking coughs of those who've done the most time in this frozen hell. The man working beside JANUSZ wields a pick, JANUSZ shovelling out the rock as it breaks up. The man pauses to light a smoke. His fingers have moulded themselves into the shape of his pick-handle - they are like hooks, the man unable to straighten his fingers. He holds the cigarette with the tips of his fingers, as if his hand was an artificial limb. JANUSZ looks around desperately, fighting off an overwhelming feeling of claustrophobia. Despite the cold, sweat beads on his forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEEPER IN THE MINE - DAY 31 KAZIK and a man known as 'THE PROF', drag a cart laden with rock up a steep incline. They wear horse collars attached to the cart by leather harnesses. (CC)NTTNTTFT)1
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE PROF's wasted frame and sallow complexion are in contrast to his lively intelligent eyes. He says something to KAZIK in Russian. He shakes his head. He doesn't speak Russian. THE PROF tries German, then English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: English, yes. They share a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was only saying, these collars - the same used by ancient Egyptian people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but on their horses probably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Same. On people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was professor of Egyptology. Leningrad University.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: manages a look at his companion, before putting even more effort into dragging the load.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER PART OF THE MINE - DAY 32 A man, enveloped in clouds of white steam, points a long pipe at the frozen rock and gravel - the heat making it easier for the pick and shovel men to dig. This is the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and he opens and shuts valves on the pipe- stem which regulates the hot steam that travels along pipes leading back to a primitive boiler. Men try to warm themselves by working near the POINT-MAN, and when the guards are not around they clutch the pipes in their hands gaining a few moments of precious warmth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows how to work the system and has found a spot here working beside the POINT-MAN. He looks across to see JANUSZ staggering up the slope toward the distant mine entrance, where a guard can be seen silhouetted against the light. He watches a moment, something not right about JANUSZ. He lays his shovel aside and hurries after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./EXT. TUNNEL - DAY 33 JANUSZ scrambling toward the surface. He stumbles, falls to his knees. He looks down, sees something on the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something buried in the dirt and rubble - paving stones. He clears away the debris to reveal a stone path. Looking up he sees the path leads to a gate framed by a hedge. His P.O.V. as he moves up the path to the gate. His unseen hand opens the gate. Now the view is of the path as he walks forward - a series of worn flagstones, then the camera tilts up to see a closed front door. A pan to the left of the door - to see a loose brick in the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./EXT. TUNNEL - DAY 34 CLOSE on JANUSZ, as SMITH is suddenly beside him, grabbing his arm and swinging him into the darkness of an adjoining tunnel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you crazy? They'll shoot you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to get out!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him. He's delirious and begins to shake with cold. SMITH grabs his shoulder and drags him back to where the POINT'-MAN works, thrusting JANUSZ's hands around the pipe. The POINT-MAN waves them away but SMITH bribes him with a slice of bread. SMITH turns back to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - the warmth of the pipe beginning to have its effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can be done? JANUSZ He knows a way through the wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slaps a hand over his mouth, glancing at the Point- Man, before dragging JANUSZ further away. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has a plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name is Khabarov. Now SMITH understands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The actor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has no intention of escaping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's aliar. Been here foryears -seeksout new arrivals, mewhen Ifirstcame here. He justlikes totalkabout escape. I'veknown others like him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should I believe you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) Nothing is for nothing in the camps. From you he gets your energy, your spirit. You feed his 'dream' of escape. You help keep him alive. He's no more than a leech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a cold bastard, Mister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm still alive, that's all I know. But I won't be in six months. And neither will you. Not in the mines. So, if you're serious about making a run for it - I'm in. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you were a loner?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't be done alone. Besides you have a weakness that could be useful to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Compassion. If anything happens to me, I'm counting on you carrying me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows he's not joking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMP KITCHEN, SAME TIME - NIGHT 35 It is snowing heavily, and after swallowing their soup, JANUSZ and his friends walk back to the barracks. KAZIK stumbles, and is helped to his feet by VOSS. He limps on to the barrack a hand resting for support on VOSS' shoulder. JANUSZ is preoccupied and he hesitates at t he door, turns, and looks back. After a moment staring at the ground he hurries inside. 36 INT. BARRACKS - NIGHT 36 JANUSZ has a puzzled KHABAROV by the arm, guiding him back to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARRACKS - NIGHT 37 He points to the ground - CLOSE on footprints as they rapidly disappear under the heavy snowfall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks from the footprints to JANUSZ, a horrified look on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a passing storm!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll do, it'll cover our tracks. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impossible! We need preparation, detailed plans, maps
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The timing will never be perfect, they won't expect it now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the distances! And food! What about food?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been trading, the American is with us. He has food, you have food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long will that last?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've spent half my life in the woods and mountains. We'll live off the land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't be done!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shocked at the change in his friends' demeanor, the appalling realization that SMITH was right about him. He seizes his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do we get through the wire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend, Lazar, he knows doesn't he? A look of fear crosses KHABAROV's face. Someone behind
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JANUSZ turns. VALKA, a few paces away watching them. KHABAROV scuttles back inside the barracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates a moment, then follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARRACKS - NIGHT A38 In the last minutes before lights out the would-be escapees make discreet preparations. Clothing and other items are traded for food and tobacco. The COOK and BOHDAN are at the center of the camp black-market and most of the trading is done with them. TOMASZ trades more pornographic sketches with BOHDAN while KAZIK tries to trade his scarf for a pair of boots - his own being in poor shape. VOSS sits beside him, and notices that KAZIK does not look directly at his shoes or the scarf, but is doing everything by feel. As they move away VOSS whispers to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't see, can you? A look of panic crosses the boy's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't leave me behind!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: conflicted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Promise me, Andrejs! I could keep a hand on your shoulder by night, and in the day I can see just fine. I won't hold you up. Please don't tell them. I'll die here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SMITH sit in a darkened corner working on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They want to know how to get through the wire. He is reluctant until SMITH produces a wristwatch from his boot. The strapless watch, of good make, settles the deal, just as the light flickers and goes out plunging the barracks into darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE CAMP - NIGHT AB38 Several shots of the wind driven snow whipping about the buildings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BARRACKS - LATER THAT NIGHT 38 The wooden building creaks and heaves like a ship at sea as the storm builds into a fully fledged blizzard. The sounds of the sleeping men, the usual cries and groans, hacking coughs, all mix into the howl of the storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the conspirators lying awake - SMITH, VOSS, KAZIK, TOMASZ and ZORAN. SMITH looks across to JANUSZ, catches his eye. A signal from JANUSZ, 'not yet'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: too, is awake. He jumps at any unexpected sound, checks his horde of food in the hiding place at the base of his bunk, as if expecting at any moment to be attacked and robbed. He sees a shadow. Someone moving about near him, a look of terror on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lies on his back listening to the storm. A movement beside him, then a knife pressed against his throat. It's VALKA. He grins, steel-capped teeth, his cross dangling from his neck. JANUSZ goes still.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are no secrets here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The game goes against me. Small debt - lose fingers. Big debt, they take head. Me, big debt. But one thing I never gamble is my Wolf. He removes the knife from JANUSZ's throat, tilts the blade to show a wolf's head incised into the blade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In forest you need knife to survive. Without? A miracle. He leans in close to JANUSZ's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You need a knife, and I need miracle to get me out of here. With a conjurer's ease he spins the knife in his fingers and arches his eyebrows - 'Deal'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMP PERIMETER - DAWN 39 Heavy snow still falling as shadowy figures run toward the wire. Shouted commands and the beam of a searchlight isolates them - not the fugitives, but a group of guards. They've found a gap in the wire. A great yelping and baying as the dog-handlers join them, releasing the dogs into the gap, then following them toward the distant forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST, SIBERIA - DAWN 40 Then seven fugitives, now including VALKA, weave in and out of the trees at a fast jog. Snow whirls about them, as, gasping for breath, they attempt to keep up with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . In the rear KAZIK holds onto VOSS' rope belt, occasionally stumbling, but VOSS has him up and on his feet fast enough to keep up with the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pauses briefly every now and then to study the moss growing on the North side of tree-trunks, before plunging on Southward. 41 FURTHER ALONG 41 They top a rise to a clearing and pause to catch their breath. The snow continues to fall but JANUSZ will allow no rest and moves off without a backward glance. 42 FURTHER STILL 42 JANUSZ is out in front when SMITH stops, resting his hands on his knees, gulping for air. The others stop too, VALKA dropping to his knees. JANUSZ runs back to VALKA, drags him to his feet. JANUSZ Get up. Or we die right now. You know how fast dogs travel. He turns to the others. JANUSZ (CONT'D) Run, damn you! Run! He moves to SMITH. JANUSZ (CONT'D) Is it time for me to carry you? (CONTINUED) Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 34.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SMITH waves him away, gets up and continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER PART OF THE FOREST - DAY 43 A feeble light penetrates the forest as day begins. The snow still falling heavily as the men stumble into a deep depression, and facing a steep climb find they can go no further. KAZIK turns his face to the light. His sight is returning with the day and he nods gratefully to VOSS. In the deep stillness the sound of distant voices. They look about them. Hard to tell the direction of the sound. JANUSZ is on his feet - there's plenty of fallen timber but no obvious place to hide. He draws a circle in the snow, mimes digging to the others, then turns to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knife .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has never taken an order from a 'Political' in his short life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your knife. With a glance to the others he reluctantly draws his knife from his boot and passes it to JANUSZ. While the group furiously dig, JANUSZ collects and trims fallen timber. As the hole deepens, JANUSZ begins to make a trellis roof. The voices change direction. They go still. Are they surrounded? They resume their digging with greater intensity, the hole now more than a meter at its deepest, JANUSZ placing the branches to cover their hide. Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 35.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY A47 Several angles on the forest. Utter stillness.Light snow falling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE HIDE, FOREST - DAY AB47 Camera moves slowly toward their hide, wisps of vapor rise from below the surface. The Russian voices are closer now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE HIDE - DAY AC47 It's like an Indian sweat-lodge as the fugitives sit shoulder to shoulder in a tight circle, ears straining, sweat running down their faces. The voices closer still. A tense moment, and then they are passing, the voices fading into silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRYSIDE, SIBERIA - NIGHT 47 The strong wind drives snow and sleet horizontally, and as they push forward they cover their faces to keep the snow from throat and lungs. VALKA, his arm wrapped defensively across his eyes, staggers and falls to his knees. JANUSZ turns back, drags him to his feet. KAZIK hangs onto the back of VOSS' coat, VOSS at times literally dragging him along. Revised 3/11/09 (Goldenrod) 36.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A TREE, FOREST - NIGHT 48 With VALKA's knife JANUSZ cuts a square of bark, pulls it from the tree, cuts two triangular holes some centimeters apart, then rams the base of the bark piece into VALKA'S collar. It's a crude mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE PROCESSION, FOREST - NIGHT 49 The group, all now wearing the improvised snow-masks, push forward against the wind, looking like a tribe from some distant age dressed in ceremonial masks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER PART OF THE FOREST - NIGHT. 50 JANUSZ in the lead, some fifty paces ahead, but he's stopped, thigh-deep in the snow, as still as a statue. The others catch up, puzzled. SMITH calls to him, lifts his mask. He's asleep. SMITH shakes him back to consciousness, all the while the storm continues at full force.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to make fire!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! You saw how close they were!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sinks to the snow, then ZORAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We die either way, might as well die warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST, LATER - NIGHT A51 A hole scraped out of the snow and a wind-break of fallen timber, is all they can manage in their exhausted state. Down in the hole JANUSZ is striking a spark from a flint. Some are fading fast, KAZIK keeps falling asleep, to be shaken awake by TOMASZ. MR. SMITH is splitting wood into ever finer shavings, ready to feed a nascent fire. Still the damp kindling will not catch. They draw closer together for warmth, draping their arms over each other's shoulders. ZORAN's head drops to his chest. TOMASZ shakes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sleep and you die. Tell us a story. (CONTTNTTFT) ) Revised 3/11/09 (Goldenrod) 37.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A51 The other look to ZORAN, and fighting the desire to sleep, he begins. VALKA loves a good story, and despite their desperate situation he listens with the attention and concentration of a small child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once upon a time, in the days of wooden ships, there was a great storm in far away seas. A merchant ship hurried toward big rocks, lightening in the sky, the waves as high as house-tops. Very, very cold, brrr! The ship smashed onto the rocks, the sailors cried in fear, called out to God, but they all drowned. All but one, Mr. Robinson Crusoe. He woke to find himself all alone on a desert island. For many years he lived without any human companions, until one day he saw something shocking! What was it? A human footprint. He was no longer alone. But was the stranger friend or foe? Another ship wrecked sailor? Or, a cannibal? All turn as a flicker of flame begins at the base of the kindling. While JANUSZ blows at the flame, MR. SMITH feeds in small shavings. The group watch with the awe and wonder usually reserved for child-birth. Then everyone is making a contribution - adding a few leaves, or tiny twigs, like offerings, as the fire grows and spreads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST, CAMPFIRE - DAWN AB51 A comfortable blaze, the group, minus JANUSZ, sleep or drowse in the life-giving warmth, when a pile of snow lands on the fire. The others react. It's JANUSZ. He heaps on more snow and the fire sputters out. By the time the others are on their feet JANUSZ is almost out of sight and they hurry to catch up, fearful of being left behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./INT. SHELTER, FOREST - DAY AC51 Ruins, deep in the forest. From the overgrown rubble they build a shelter, discovering as they do, evidence that this was once a small, remote, Soviet gulag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Revised 3/11/09 (Goldenrod) 37A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : AC51 LATER, the fugitives sit shoulder to shoulder in a tight circle. They shiver in their padded jackets, rub frozen limbs. VALKA looks up to find SMITH staring at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stare at me like the snake at the rabbit or is it the other way 'round?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to the others with a silver-toothed smile, indicates SMITH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He teach me English. Speak good, huh? Bread for words, wasn't it cowboy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds his gaze a moment before being distracted by a thumping sound outside. The group go very still. A second thump, overhead this time. VALKA draws his knife. A trickle of snow falls through the vent in the roof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Snow, falling from trees. They relax a little.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When can we travel by day?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I say. (CONTTNTTFT) )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : (2) AC51 KAZIK glances at VOSS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How far have we come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty, thirty kilometers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Less, if we've been going in circles, like the chicken without its head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How can you tell we're heading South?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reads the trees, don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something like that. He spreads out a piece of cloth on the snow at his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, let's see what you've got. No one moves. JANUSZ reaches into his own pockets, emptying the contents onto the cloth - several slices of bread, half a kilo of buckwheat, some dried meat, a swatch of tobacco. SMITH goes next with a larger store of bread and a little salt. VOSS has a collection of small fish-heads which he adds to the store. TOMASZ, KAZIK and ZORAN make their contributions. They stare grimly at their limited food supply. Various other items are added - a razor blade, a length of cord, a piece of barbed-wire, etc. SMITH picks up the barbed wire, examines it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valka?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reluctantly reaches into his coat - something familiar about it with its distinctive fur-lined collar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Khabarov's coat. (CONTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : ( 3) AC51 He smiles at JANUSZ as he produces a bulging sack from inside his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT'D.) Yes...and... From the sack he produces KHABAROV's hoarded supply of food and other items. Off JANUSZ's reaction - VALKA (CONT'D) He was going to inform. Don't worry. I talk to him. Everything o.k. He puts the goods back in the sack and goes to place it inside his coat. JANUSZ We share.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches out for the sack of food. VALKA glances at the others, then passes it to him. TOMASZ has already begun to organize seven slices of bread laying one of VOSS's fish heads on each. one. He hands them out. They eat in silence, savoring every bite. ZORAN removes the fish-head, passing it back to TOMASZ. Then he places a thin layer of snow on the bread like a canape. He eats daintily, his little finger extended like a dowager at a tea party, raising a smile from his exhausted companions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST - NIGHT. AD51 The wind is rising, whipping flurries of snow through the trees. SMITH and JANUSZ are in the lead. SMITH refers back to VALKA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've made a bargain with the Devil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you got a knife? They move on in silence, JANUSZ not liking his bargain any more than SMITH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: finds himself walking beside VALKA. (MNTTNTTFD ) Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 40.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AE51 LATER, THAT NIGHT AE51 SMITH

direction.raw_text: : AE51 VALKA For direction he looks at grass and mosses, what's that? I swear to God he better know what he's doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be grateful you're here at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gratitude is for dogs. He moves away from SMITH, his eyes fixed on JANUSZ, who is again studying moss on the side of a tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST - DAWN 51 The group in the shelter of the trees. The sky is overcast but at least it's not too cold. Everywhere about is deep snow from the recent storm. TOMASZ prepares a meal from their dry rations, small portions for men who have expended so much energy. KAZIK examines his swollen blistered feet. VALKA has his boots off, shaking them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clean inside boots, foot-cloths.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: copies him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man on run - one tiny piece of sand can make cripple, I swear to God. The others are listening, and some do likewise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST - NIGHT 52 With lengths of wood as 'ski-poles', the group begin to make up lost time. VOSS has lashed his rope-belt to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who walks behind him. SMITH wonders about this, but says nothing. They pause at the top of a rise amongst the trees, on hearing the sound of dogs howling from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wolves it's only wolves. (CONTTNTTFT) )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relieved, they continue forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Only wolves', great. A53 THE SUN A53 From behind clouds, the sun appears, shafting light toward the earth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIDGE, MOUNTAIN TOP, SIBERIA - DAY 53 The upturned faces of the fugitives. Sun worshipers all. JANUSZ a short distance away. He plants his 'ski-pole' in the snow, marking the tip of its shadow with a pine- cone. They watch as he draws a line in the snow from the second marker - about a foot in length. Then he stands, and with the toe of his left foot at the first pine-cone and the toe of his right foot at the end of the line in the snow, he points, calling to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: South! To Lake Baikal! Cheers from the watching group. JANUSZ (CONT'D) Now we travel by day. They move off down toward a distant valley, ZORAN the last to leave, doubt on his face as he studies the series of seemingly endless forested hills stretching before them. 54-61 OMITTED 54-61 A62 LATER STILL - DAY A62 The group push on with renewed energy. VALKA hurries to keep up with JANUSZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are the 'Pakhan'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's 'Pakhan'? (CONTTNUTFFD ) Revised 3/17/09 (Cherry) 42.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A62 VALKA Boss of criminals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not criminals, we're escaping from criminals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God you win my respect with your sticks and pine-cones. I'll stand between you and death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to be my bodyguard?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the Urka way. You have me and you have the Wolf. He touches the knife in its bark sheath at his belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: increases the pace, VALKA pushing himself to keep up with his 'Pakhan'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATER, FIRESIDE - DUSK 62 The fugitives settle for the coming night. As TOMASZ unpacks their meagre food supply JANUSZ sketches a map on a piece of birch-bark. The other sit exhausted, some close to sleep, except SMITH who is working the piece of barbed wire from KHABAROV's stash.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) I have us here somewhere. Above Lake Baikal their former camp is marked. South of the lake, the Trans-Siberian Railway, a little further South the Russo/Mongolian border. With a twig he points to a spot seemingly not far from the prison camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R to see the disappointed faces of the group - the distance yet to cover overwhelming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you going all the way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Mongolia? No. I go further. To America. The first SMITH has heard of this. TOMASZ turns from examining their store of food. (C.ONTTNUTED ) Revised 3/17/09 (Cherry) 43.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have food for another week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can make traps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll be moving too fast to wait for traps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We find farms, villages, get food there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a bounty on our heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We steal it. At night. They never know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not thieves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll steal it, and I'll eat. You can watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is working the length of barbed-wire someone added earlier to their communal store. His fingers are bleeding as he struggles to separate the strands of wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbed-wire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puzzled, but TOMASZ gets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's making a fish-hook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: smiles at SMITH's ingenuity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's how we'll survive isn't it, Mister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fish? I don't eat fish. (RNNTTNUED ) Revised 3/17/09 (Cherry) 44.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then you'll die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has a far-away look in his sight-less eyes. He speaks in Polish to JANUSZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He asked Janusz if he believes in God's forgiveness. This has come from seemingly nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save your philosophy. Concentrate on keeping up with us instead. He gets up and goes in search of more wood, the others surprised at his cold tone. The rest of the group also begin to prepare their camp. Most gather wood while TOMASZ, the 'quartermaster', makes their meal, and JANUSZ the fire. VOSS keeps an eye on
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who, demonstrating his independence while it's still light, and his desire to contribute, returns with a load of wood, turning back into the forest for more. Others gather wood, and as the light fades, begin to take up positions by the growing fire, roll cigarettes, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks anxiously for KAZIK. He has not returned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST - DUSK A65 KAZIK lost. He moves along a right to left trajectory, i.e. North, heading away for the campsite, his sight beginning to fade with the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE - NIGHT 65 The group range out from the fire calling KAZIK's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns to JANUSZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has night-blindness. Revised 3/17/09 (Cherry) 44A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST - NIGHT 66 KAZIK stumbling through the whiteout. He stops. Did he hear his name? He moves on, pleased to find by his side the Professor from the mine. (CONTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought I was alone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I've been walking with you for some time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll just sit for a minute. The PROF. sits beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Not far to go. He points, and KAZIK sees - the Pyramids of Giza, deep inside the fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We made it. We really made it. Isn't that something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE - DAWN 67 They find KAZIK not a hundred yards from where they camped. The weather has broken, the fog gone. He sits looking toward them, his bare feet stretched out before him, his eyes wide open. On his lips a frozen smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A CAIRN OF STONES - DAY 68 They stand by his grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A free man died here today. Amens are muttered. The group remain by the grave reluctant to leave. All but VALKA who looks about restlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Young always die first. The others look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the camps. He looks at their somber faces. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still, one less mouth to feed what? You're all thinking the same thing. He wanders away toward the embers of their fire. A69 A STREAM, FOREST - DAY A69 SMITH hauling in fish, hand over hand. The others watching in fascination. TOMASZ Where did you learn to fish like that? SMITH Lived in the woods a while. VALKA In America. SMITH In America. ZORAN And how did you come to be in Russia? SMITH I made a mistake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SIBERIAN WILDERNESS - TIMELAPSE - DAY/DUSK/DAWN 69 High, wide, panoramas, the tiny figures of the fugitives threading their way through the trees heading steadily Southward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SIBERIAN WILDERNESS - DAY 70 Close on Nature naturing - birds calling from high branches, bees buzzing, a grub crawling along a leaf. And a large animal grazing. Or what appears at first to be an animal. It's VALKA, on all fours, picking up and eating bugs. Others are there grazing too. The weeks have taken their toll and they look thin and starving. We see in detail their search for anything edible: hands digging out roots and berries of various kinds which are tested with a tentative nibble and sometimes spat out if too bitter; ( CONTTNTTF;D )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has made a small trap - a noose rigged on a branch and just beyond it a nut. A squirrel watches. Not all food is shared in this extreme situation and some, with a furtive look about them, eat what they find. 71 EXT. CAVE - SAME TIME - DAY 71 They are camped at the mouth of a cathedral like cave, and here TOMASZ amuses himself by sketching on the cave wall using charcoal from the fire. Among portraits of the group are scenes from life in Camp 105. On the fire a stew of water and pine-needles bubbles away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches idly from where he lies near the cave entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll find our bones and your drawings a hundred years from now, and say - 'a fine example of Early Gulag Man'. (CONTTNUED )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up with your jokes! Go and find food like the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do the shutting up! Drawing like you're on holiday. I'm sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cook. They find food. What do you ever do? Nothing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I make them laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns away from him, curling up into a foetal position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./INT. CAVE - DUSK 72 SMITH walking through the vast cave, his attention caught by two massive holes in the roof. He walks on toward their camp outside an opening at the far end. 73 EXT. CAVE - DUSK 73 TOMASZ has water boiling on the fire. He calls to the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you have? Come on, no holding back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches from the cave, hands over two small fish, his day's catch. VOSS steps forward with a dead squirrel. VALKA has nothing. TOMASZ reaches for their cooking pot cooling by the fire. He passes a cup to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pine-needle tea. (CNNTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JANUSZ sips, reacts to the bitterness of the brew,then passes it on. 74 EXT./INT. CAVE - NIGHT 74 Sleeping figures by the fire. TOMASZ tosses and turns, muttering in his sleep. JANUSZ is awake as is VALKA who sits close beside him. A whispered conversation -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who will be first?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean the first to die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods, indicates TOMASZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think that sucker, the artist. But better if it was him. He nods toward ZORAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It might be you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why 'better' if it's Zoran?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: squeezes the flesh of his upper arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More soft. More tender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shakes his head, 'no'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister only gets little fish now. We must have meat, or we die. You're the Pakhan, you've thought of it. We all have. That's why you brought extra people isn't it? For food? An old Urka escape trick. I swear to God you were an Urka in another life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get food when we get to Lake Baikal, plenty of fish there. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You said we should have seen Lake a week ago. We're lost, Pakhan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares into the fire as VALKA lays down to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is ZORAN's turn on watch and he stands near the entrance to the cave, his blanket about his shoulders, looking out into the still night. Behind him a low growling sound, coming from deep in the cave. He turns, a look of terror on his face. He can see nothing but a dim light deep in the cave where moonlight penetrates through two large holes in the cave roof. He wakes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: alerting him to the sound. JANUSZ in turn wakes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and after taking burning sticks from the fire they walk back inside the vast cave toward the source of the sound, VALKA drawing his knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAVE - NIGHT 75 The dim light shows a wolf-pack growling as they pick at a carcass on the cave floor. They drop their bones and face the intruders, baring their fangs, all now growling. On a signal from JANUSZ they rush the wolves, who run back toward another exit from the cave. MR. SMITH, TOMASZ and VOSS come hurrying to join them, woken by all the barking and shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: falls on part of the carcass, cutting off chunks of raw meat. The others do likewise. Wider on the group, down on all fours chewing on the remains of the kill, only JANUSZ stands back, watching them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ./INT. CAVE - EARLY MORNING 76 Some sleep on, others stir, their movements slow and listless. They are near the end. This has been JANUSZ's point of view as he packs a few scraps of food into his pockets and picks up his staff. Those awake stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back in a week - if I find the lake. If not, you're on your own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I come too. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) I'll travel faster alone. Mr. Smith will be the Pakhan while I'm gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns and with a nod of the head 'follow me', to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: he moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SOME DISTANCE FROM CAMP - DAWN 77 Now out of earshot, JANUSZ turns to SMITH. SMITH knows what it's about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Valka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let him out of your sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck. As JANUSZ heads off into the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OPEN COUNTRY, SIBERIA - DAY 78 A magnificent vista - a broad plain sweeping toward a distant line of hills. It's a beautiful clear day and the lone figure of JANUSZ, dwarfed by the landscape, walks steadily Southward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROCKY HILLSIDE - DUSK 79 Sheltering from the wind on the leeside of a hill, he takes pine-cones from his pocket, breaks them open and eats the seeds. Then he's up and off again, leaning heavily on his staff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A BARREN PLAIN - DAY 80 The weather changes from a clear Spring morning to cold and overcast as gusts of wind whip down from distant slopes. JANUSZ bends into the wind, his pace slowing. He stumbles, sinks to the ground, fighting the desire to let go, to give himself to sleep, and the swift death that will surely follow. His eyes begin to close. Then he sees it. Just ahead of him. The gate. The gate from his vision in the mine. He struggles to his feet, staggers on - ( C'ONTTNTTFD 1 51.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JANUSZ'S VISION: A repeat of his earlier hallucination - the click of the gate latch, the flagstones at his feet as he moves down the path. (All the while the accompanying sound is of JANUSZ's laboured breathing in the present 'reality'). He's at the front door, camera pans to the loose brick in the wall beside the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE, FOREST - DUSK 81 JANUSZ staggers back into camp, half dead and shivering with cold. VALKA is quickly beside him with SMITH and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three days from here. South by West. He collapses. VOSS shouts for the fire to be built up, hot water to be boiled. He feels his pulse, checks his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stones! Gather stones! Heat them in the fire!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE, STILL LATER - NIGHT 82 Throughout the night they take turns replacing the hot stones surrounding his body and massaging his feet and hands. On one such occasion SMITH finds himself at JANUSZ's side. JANUSZ opens his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the 'brick'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did I say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something about a loose brick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods, offers no explanation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know if you don't pull through soon we'll have to leave you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I expect nothing less. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you better get better quick if you want to see home again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could've used you in the Polish army. Fired you out of a cannon. He closes his eyes, lapses back into a deep sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HILLSIDE, SIBERIA - DUSK 84 It's a beautiful evening as the file of travellers climb toward the crest of the hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAIN, SIBERIA - DUSK 85 From the crest, a panorama of Lake Baikal - a massive body of water stretching to the horizon. The fugitives rest, and consider the next stage of their journey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're going to have to follow the Western shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But look, it bends like that - won't it take us longer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See all those settlements on the other side? We'd never get through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God, those mother- fuckers would cut off our heads, take them to secret police. Get more for us than they would for their fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: impatient to move on, is already on his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rolls onto his back with a groan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A TRACK, LAKESIDE - DAY 88 SMITH and VOSS are last in line as they move cautiously along a dirt track. SMITH keeps looking back over his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? (CONTTNTTFD ) Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 54.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: signals JANUSZ to stop, while holding a finger to his lips for silence. JANUSZ joins him, followed by the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're being followed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Followed? Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty yards back. A man on his own. May have seen us - crossed into the trees beside the track. A silence as they consider their options. VALKA draws his knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No killing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No? I think you've killed before. You say too many prayers for an innocent man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives us away, the soldiers will be on us in no time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valka, go back on the other side of the track, then come up behind, in case he makes a run for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves off, gliding through the trees on the left of the track. The others wait a beat, then move into the trees on the right side of the track picking up fallen timber as weapons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is in the lead when in a clearing not fifty paces ahead, a figure steps out from behind a tree. JANUSZ stops, holding up a hand for the others to stay where they are. He stares at the small figure - a young woman. There's a glimpse of a dirty skirt under her coat, a scarf tied loosely about her neck. Wisps of chestnut hair stray out from under a moth-eaten fur hood. She looks frightened and desperate. (CONTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From her waif like appearance, it's hard to tell her age - an old thirteen or a young sixteen? The men discreetly drop their irovised weapons. She looks ready to make a run for it on seeing VALKA with his drawn knife. JANUSZ gestures for the others to fall back, as he cautiously approaches, uttering reassuring words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PATHWAY, WOODS - LATER - DAY 89 The others sit smoking by the pathway, watching as JANUSZ crosses back from the GIRL to join them. He says something to TOMASZ in Polish. A rapid exchange between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's Polish. Been following us for several days.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does she want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Food? Protection? She's been too afraid to approach us until she was sure we weren't Russians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wants to travel with us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's on the run, like us. Escaped from a Russian collective farm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear to God I know this type - street gypsies, there are thousands like that, less use than a dog!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks back to the GIRL who watches them from the clearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pakhan. Don't do this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's starving. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can't feed ourselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoran?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's kinder to leave her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's been sent to us. We can't leave her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: knows this is true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .THE CLEARING, WOODS - DAY 90 The GIRL watches as JANUSZ approaches. From the way he doesn't look at her she knows their answer. JANUSZ stands before her a moment. They speak in Polish (sub- titled).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. He reaches into his bag, passes her a fish and some nuts and berries. It's all she can do to refrain from eating it right away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go back. He guesses at what this might mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we had enough food She stares at him, nods, then walks back toward the path, returning in the direction from which she came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PATHWAY, WOODS - DAY 91 The group walk in silence, the encounter with the girl and their subsequent decision weighing heavily on some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: keeps looking back over his shoulder. Revised 3/31/09 (Tan) 57.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAKESIDE - DAY 92 LATER, the group walking out in the open by the lake when their attention is caught by the sight of a flock of ravens circling and diving on something up ahead - just out of sight around a bend in the lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAKESIDE, MOMENTS LATER - DAY 93 SMITH is the first to see it - a full grown reindeer bogged to the shoulders in the soft mud by the lake's edge. As they approach the ravens rise in a great flapping of wings. The group circle the wild-eyed beast, pathetic in it's attempts to pull itself out of the bog, faced now with this new and more deadly threat. VALKA draws his knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A COVE, LAKESIDE - DAY 94 TOMASZ already has a fire going when the rest of the party appear dragging the carcass of the reindeer on an improvised sled made of driftwood. VOSS watches a moment as preparations are made to butcher the animal, then he turns and hurries back in the direction from which they came. JANUSZ watches him. He knows where he's going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAKESIDE/PATHWAY - DAY 95 VOSS moving fast beside the lake, then onto the track, running now, retracing their steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE, LAKE - DUSK 96 TOMASZ butchers more meat from the reindeer using VALKA's knife, while SMITH sets up a wooden rotisserie on the fire assisted by ZORAN. JANUSZ and VALKA are part way through skinning the beast when they pause on hearing footsteps. Around the point comes VOSS, followed by the girl. As they approach, an expectant silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name is, Irena.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE - LATER - NIGHT 97 They eat in silence, savoring every mouthful. We hear the sounds of eating - bones sucked to the marrow; fingers licked; bones crunching. (CNNTTNTTRT) ) Revised 3/31/09 (Tan) 58.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is like a half-starved animal, eating with absorbed concentration, the others sneaking looks in her direction as they savor the fresh killed meat. - DAWN 98 98 EXT. CAMPSITE, LAKESIDE JANUSZ has been on the last watch of the night, and as dawn breaks he approaches his sleeping companions. He stares down at IRENA, sleeping like a child by the fire. Slowly the others stir, all moving slowly and quietly, not wanting to disturb her sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAKESIDE, CAMPSITE - DAY 99 ZORAN has set himself up as camp barber - trimming hair and shaving heads using the razor-blade inserted in the end of a stick, and for shaving cream, a chunk of fat from the reindeer. JANUSZ has just been shaved and trimmed, the last but for VALKA. While the others wash themselves and their clothes, ZORAN calls for VALKA, who approaches reluctantly and sits on the rock before the barber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do we do this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we don't look like thieves and robbers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches him, blade in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very still, please. He tilts VALKA's neck, seemingly the better to shave him. In fact, he enjoys teasing VALKA and his movements are slow and ominous, VALKA clearly nervous. - DAY/NIGHT 100 100 EXT. MONTAGE, CAMPSITE Various scenes of maintenance, repairs and the breaking down of the reindeer into anything of use during their journey. Two fires burn - their regular cooking fire and one for the smoking of meat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; Cleaning bones of shreds of meat then beginning the construction of a bone frame for a backpack. He later gets part of the skin to form the bag attached to the frame. Still later he collects nearby vines, rolling them up for future use. (CNNTTNTTRT) ) Revised 3/31/09 (Tan) 58A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: TOMASZ; In between sketching scenes of his friends at work he skims fat from the pot filled with boiling bones, and lays out strips of meat given to him by VALKA to dry in the sun, part of the jerked meat they will carry as a long term food supply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; With the 'Wolf' he separates sinews and tendons from the beast, to form much needed bindings for their journey. He also cuts meat for their jerked supply, or to be smoked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; Makes firstly a large bone needle, then later makes repairs in his clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; After cleaning his teeth with a twig, hangs his suit on a driftwood hanger and is seen brushing it with a branch from a pine tree. TOMASZ teases him and suggests he do something useful. Later this leads to him sorting the boiled bones into various sizes, a sort of accountant of the 'bone-bank'. 'Customers' come to him looking for bones or teeth for various uses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; Works on the reindeer skin. With SMITH's help he stretches it to dry on a driftwood frame. Later, he cuts a piece off and gives it to VOSS for the back-pack. He also works scraping the skin of strands of unwanted meat and fat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; Sleeps and eats. It is only at dusk one day she seems to come to life and moving to the lakeside washes her clothes and hair. The men try not to stare, and whether their thoughts are carnal or not, whether she reminds them of family or girlfriend, they are all affected by her transformation from boy/urchin, into a young woman when she returns washed, and wearing the dress she has carried rolled-up on her back. Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 59.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPFIRE, LAKESIDE - NIGHT 101 SMITH and JANUSZ some distance from the campsite collecting wood. By the fire ZORAN leads the 'Survivors Band'. He has them drumming on logs, tapping sticks, harmonizing, amid much laughter. JANUSZ watches IRENA. Then he turns to SMITH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's educated. Speaks good English. And French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't like her, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speak to Valka about her. He doesn't even think she's Polish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did speak to him. And the others. They agree she comes with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's decided then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You disagree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apart from food she'll slow us down. There's no room for sentimentality. You know that. (CONTTNT7FD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he turns, moving back to the fire with his load of wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PATHWAY, WOODS - DAY 102 Refreshed and revived and laden with their supplies from the deer, they make their way along a narrow dirt track by the lake. IRENA is aware that the main opposition to her joining with them comes from VALKA and SMITH. SMITH she knows is the more important, and she tries to keep up with him. Occasionally catching his eye, she tries to charm him with a coquettish smile beyond her years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER/LAKE - DAY 103 A river flowing into the lake presents an obstacle. They walk along the edge to where the river begins to narrow, but here it's still frozen, and a quick test with JANUSZ's staff shows it to be too thin to take their weight. They look upstream - a distant figure of a man, a hunter possibly, a shotgun over his shoulder, on their side of the bank. There's clearly no choice but to swim for it. They make hasty preparations, removing outer clothing, except shirts and trousers, tying their boots about their necks. IRENA watches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you swim?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't lie to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not lying, Comrade. That was a slip of the tongue, and SMITH is made uneasy by it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And don't call me, 'comrade'. With a shout the group plunge into the icy water, swimming one-handed, their packs held above water level in the other. It's only when they reach the other side they realize IRENA is still on the opposite bank. The others urge her to swim across. She hesitates a moment then runs upstream to where the river is frozen. (CNNTTNTTFTD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They watch in astonishment as in a series of leaps and bounds she's out on the ice heading for the opposite bank. Ice cracks beneath her feet and a couple of times it seems she'll fall in, but with a last great leap over a section of free-flowing water she makes it to the other side, hurrying down to join the others a broad smile on her face. She looks defiantly at SMITH. JANUSZ is worried about the man having seen them, and urges them to follow him into the tree-line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST, A SHORT TIME LATER - DAY A106 They scramble up a steep, forested slope, with occasional backward glances to see if the hunter is following. There's no sign of him. 106 EXT. LAKESIDE - DAY 106 Some time later the group, still a little damp, walk by the lake. IRENA walks beside SMITH whose long strides force her to jog occasionally to keep up. They swat at mosquitoes as they walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janusz tells me your family were Kulaks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Just a cow and some pigs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Were your parents arrested with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're dead. She swats at a few mosquitos hovering around her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We lived on a farm outside Warsaw. When the Russians came they said we were 'kulaks', and exploiting the peasants. My parents were afraid and hid me in the barn. The mosquitos are getting worse and SMITH grabs swatches of leaves, passing one to IRENA as they walk on, swinging away at the annoying insects. (C_C)NTTNTTRT) )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found them later. Face down in the mud. They'd been bashed and strangled with barbed wire. She looks up at SMITH, her eyes filling with tears. (('_NNTTNTTF'T) )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later, the Russians caught me, and sent me to a collective farm. They were cruel to me. I ran away. I had no food. Then I saw you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They walk in silence a few paces, and she dries with the corner of her sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't swim can you? She looks up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've never been in the water in your life. She laughs coquettishly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I got across, didn't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And, you said you lived on a farm near Warsaw?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Soviets didn't get that far. That was German territory. She nervously swats the mosquitos.
direction.name: direction
