direction.raw_text: Your parents weren't murdered were they? You made it all up. pinched, She won't look at him, her face looks thin and she seems older.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've all done terrible things to survive. But don't ever lie to me again. We've had enough of lies. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She sneaks a glance back over her shoulder at the others, then up at SMITH. She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD, OUTSIDE A SMALL TOWN,LAKE BAIKAL - LATE 108 AFTERNOON A fishing village by the lake. Timber houses straggling back up into the surrounding hills. From cover, they consider the obstacle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll have to go 'round it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quicker through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll have dogs. Raise the alarm. We wouldn't stand a chance
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need food again, Pakhan. (CCONTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

result.heading: ROAD, OUTSIDE A SMALL TOWN,LAKE BAIKAL

direction.raw_text: I know we need food, but we're not going into that town, risk everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're wasting time. He strikes off up a slope toward the hills behind the town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .HILLS BEHIND VILLAGE - DUSK 109 The group make their way uphill and around the town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .TOWN, LAKESIDE - NIGHT A110 Their P.O.V. down to the few lights of the town and the lake glimmering in the moonlight. From the direction of the town - the sound of a dog barking in an agitated fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HILLS BEHIND VILLAGE, SAME TIME - NIGHT AB110 SMITH joins JANUSZ. Off his expression:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? What's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Valka?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was behind Zoran.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you watch Valka?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not his keeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn him! He looks back down to the town. 65.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE GROUNDS OF A HOUSE, VILLAGE

direction.raw_text: . THE GROUNDS OF A HOUSE, VILLAGE - NIGHT 110 A dim light through a side window - the glimpse of a woman crossing through frame, followed shortly after by the weathered face of a fisherman. He's heard something. He crosses to the window, peers out into the darkness. The moment he turns away the camera moves on around the side to the rear of the building, past a rabbit in a cage. VALKA's shoulder comes into frame as he edges his way toward the back door, passing the sightless skull of a dried fish swinging from a cord under the eaves. He reaches for the door-handle, opens it, and slips silently inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TOWN, LAKESIDE - NIGHT Alll A view along a road to the town. (P.O.V. now on the opposite side of town to that seen earlier.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .TREES, ROADSIDE - NIGHT 111 Theabove P.O.V. is that of the group waiting for VALKA. Theysit by the roadside looking toward the town. They swatat a cloud of mosquitoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He could turn us in for the bounty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And risk arrest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'd bribe his way out of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would he do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He might.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an opportunity. We're rid of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't need his knife. We can make one from deer bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! Let's go! (CONTTNTTRD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A movement behind them, they turn as VALKA steps out from behind a tree. He stares back at them a crooked grin on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves swiftly, grabs him by his collar and spins him into the tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, easy cowboy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could have got us all killed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You tear my coat
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fool! He releases him and VALKA staggers back, reaching down to a bulging sack. He tips out the contents - various foodstuffs including a freshly killed rabbit and a bottle of vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Fool' is it? It's then they notice blood splashed over his trousers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Did I kill you ask? Yes. A dog. (HE LAUGHS) Don't believe me? So don't eat. But you will won't you? Because you want survival. I know about survival! All my life. He holds up the bottles of vodka, one half empty
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it's my birthday! With a wild look in his eyes, he passes a bottle to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then flicks the side of his neck with his middle finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Russia that means we drink!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPFIRE - LATER - NIGHT 112 TOMASZ tends the rabbit roasting on the fire, while the vodka bottle is passed hand to hand. When not drinking, the group are swatting at the persistent mosquitoes,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: now badly bitten. VALKA doesn't seem bothered by the mosquitoes, perhaps tatoos keep them away, anyway he's feeling generally pleased with himself and is very talkative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know when they put the children of the political prisoners in the orphanage, they change their names, so later, the parents can never find them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what happened to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) I didn't have parents. But that's what happened to her. He passes IRENA the bottle. She glares back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it? You told me that. She glances at the puzzled faces of the others, finally looking at SMITH. He holds her gaze. Then she takes a slug of the vodka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They called me 'Rykov', but I remembered our Polish name - 'Zulinski'. I used to say it every night before I went to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The story you told us
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought that story would be more sad, and you wouldn't leave me behind. Again she looks at SMITH. She made a promise to him. (CONTTNTTRD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My parents were Polish communists. They took us to live in Soviet Union - to Moscow. They want to work for the Revolution. (MORE) (('.nNTTNTTFT) 1 68.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We lived in the Hotel Luxe with lots of foreign communists. But they arrested them. In 1937. Said they were spies. The police put me in the orphanage. And my brother. He died. I was ten years old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you ran away. She nods. VALKA grinning proudly at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lived in the streets, like me! He breaks into one of his Urki songs. IRENA translates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about a mother complaining to her son that he's a thief, just like his father... it goes on and says, 'but if you are strong enough to fight 'til death - you will conquer fate'. She joins VALKA in the chorus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LAKESIDE - DAY 113 The mosquitos continue to plaguethem,swirling in clouds about their heads, crawling intoears,eyes and mouths. They have improvised headgear -coats,swatches of leaves, improvised masks. Many are badly bitten, faces swollen, bites infected. SMITH walks beside JANUSZ. SMITH What can we do? Steal a boat? JANUSZ No. SMITH People are going to get ill. JANUSZ I know. SMITH After all we've faced, how strange, these tiny insects might defeat us. 68A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY A114 The group collect potatoes in a ploughed field by the lake. ZORAN can no longer take the mosquitoes, and to the astonishment of the others, he runs toward the water, shedding his coat as he goes, eventually diving into the water and submerging himself. 114 EXT. LAKESIDE, LATER - DAY 114 From a concealed position in the trees they watch as half a dozen peasants walk by the lake. ZORAN studies them intently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No mosquitos. The others unsure of his meaning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have no mosquitos!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VARIOUS LOCATIONS, LAKESIDE - DAY/DUSK 115 The group have by now a walking routine which they rarely vary, always occupying the same positions in extended line. JANUSZ as navigator in the lead, SMITH generally bringing up the rear. IRENA is the exception - varying her place, now with one, now with another. They don't talk much to each other as they walk but they do talk with her. She has the knack of getting anyone to talk. No doubt a skill learnt in her life on the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST NEAR THE ROAD - DAY 116 A small fire burns as TOMASZ cooks a fish stolen by VALKA. The smoke from the fire is not enough to alleviate the mosquito problem and the group swat in miserable silence. Suddenly SMITH throws dirt on the fire, suffocating it with his jacket. He points to the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD - DAY 117 From their point of view a fisherman in his fifties, a basket in a sling on his back, walks abreast of them on the track.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOREST - DAY 118 As he passes, ZORAN speaks in a whisper to JANUSZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There it is! Again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: mystified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares again at the man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No mosquitos!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is up and off before anyone can stop him. They watch in appalled silence as he approaches and speaks to the man, who regards this stranger appearing from the forest with some suspicion. ZORAN does a kind of crazy dance, talking all the while. (CNNTTNTTED ) Revised 4/23/09 (Buff) 70.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soon the man is laughing, and putting down his bag and gun he takes something from around his neck and places it on ZORAN's neck. A few more words, and more laughter, then with a handshake ZORAN heads back into the forest, the man continuing on his way. ZORAN rejoins them, holding up the gift from the old man - strands of intertwined bark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mosquito repellent! And I have the formula!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD - DAY 119 LATER. They all wear necklaces of the entwined bark and are mosquito free. ZORAN is the hero of the hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what did you say to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That I was an escaped convict who was being plagued by mosquitos. As they round a bend and disappear from sight, TOMASZ's voice drifts back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Very funny. But what did you really say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY A120 JANUSZ scoops up a handful of water where it laps a beach. It's a symbolic end to their lake trek, and they turn and walk on, the lake behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A FIELD, SIBERIA - DAY 120 In the far distance a large town dominated by a collection of smoke stacks, belching out columns of smoke into the sky, as the group hurry across open ground to the shelter of the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRYSIDE - DAY A121 A rustic cart passes by. After it has gone the fugitives emerge from concealment and resume their journey. Revised 4/23/09 (Buff) 70aA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRYSIDE - DAY AB121 VOSS, ZORAN and TOMASZ talk of their pre-Gulag days with
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VOSS A small stone church in a little village. Very peaceful. I grew up in that village. Then, ZORAN I went on business. Once a year - government clients of course! Then, TOMASZ .layers of very fine pastry, so when you bite there is a lightness, a delicacy - it should almost melt in the mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . OPEN COUNTRY - DAY 121 The group move at a brisk pace. IRENA walks beside
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (C'(-)NTTNU ED 1 71.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: IRENA (V.0.) And Tomasz is a pastry chef but wants to be an artist?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Zoran was on business in Moscow, arrested in Red Square, he said he was just taking a photo of the Kremlin! He's an accountant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'll be damned. Never knew a funny accountant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you talk to each other?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the camps you learn to say as little as possible. They walk on in silence, IRENA sneaking a look up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRYSIDE, LATER - DAY 123 IRENA now walking with JANUSZ.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Smith? An American? Working on the Moscow metro?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's an engineer. His father was Finnish. Grew up in America, but he could speak Russian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did he come to Russia for God's sake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Depression. His son came with him. (CONTTNTTFD ) Revised 3/16/09 (Salmon) 72.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to his son?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They shot him. He was seventeen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A STREAM - DUSK 124 The group fords a shallow stream when IRENA sees SMITH limp to a rock where he sits and inspects his blistered, bleeding feet IRENA kneels before him, dries his feet with her dress. The others watch silently as she tears strips from her petticoat and binds up the raw spots between his toes.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A RIDGE ABOVE THE TRANS-SIBERIAN RAILWAY

direction.raw_text: . A RIDGE ABOVE THE TRANS-SIBERIAN RAILWAY - DAY 125 The GROUP look down to see the railway track lined with villagers every few miles, making a crossing especially hazardous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mongolian border is on the other side of those tracks. Two ARMED SOLDIERS can be seen walking along the tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't we go around this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the main line. It's going to be like this everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't have a choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We cross at night. Their attention is caught by the passing of a long freight train, horn sounding over the bucolic scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A RIDGE ABOVE THE RAILWAY-LINE - DAY 126 A visible tension in the group as they wait. VALKA whittles a piece of deer-bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that you're making? (CNNTTNTTRD ) Revised 3/16/09 (Salmon) 72A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cross for your tombstone. (CNNTTNTTFT)1
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: surprised at his tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should you care what I'm making? The evening is hot and VALKA has his shirt open, the tattooed portraits of Lenin and Stalin on his chest appear and disappear in the folds of his shirt. This amuses ZORAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Valka?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you have arseholes tattooed on your chest?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stops. Stares back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't they be on your arse so you sit on them every time you take a shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think it's funny? They are great men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch your eyes, crowbait! He makes a 'V' with his fingers followed by a short stabbing motion. ZORAN reels back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you know what 'Stalin' means funny man? Man-of-Steel. He takes from rich and gives to poor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure he does. Then he puts both of them in a camp for twenty-five years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes back to his carving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RAILWAY TRACKS - NIGHT A127 JANUSZ stands on the tracks lookingdownthelinetoa cutting where the track disappearsaroundabend.The sound of an approaching train, a dim light already reflected on the side of the cutting. He turns and looks toward the trees where the others are approaching down a wooded hillside. He hurries toward them, urging them to take cover in the bracken beside the track. SMITH points out a glowing red light further down the track from the approaching train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RAILWAY TRACK - NIGHT AB127 The train thunders into the cutting with a squeal of breaks as the driver sights the red light on the track ahead, and the train slows to a stop. 127 EXT. BESIDE THE TRACK - NIGHT 127 Close on the faces of the escapees as they look up to the carriages stopped in front of them. They are cattle- cars, but its soon apparent their cargo is human. From the high windows, hands can be seen clutching the bars. From inside a communal groaning and sighing. Voices, female voices, cry out for water, and on the agonized faces of the fugitives a mixture of pain and empathy. Then the train seems to sigh, like a great beast, and from beneath the carriages flow streams of blood and urine. As the distant light turns green the train slowly moves forward, and as it does so, letters and notes drop to the tracks from the barred windows. After it is gone they scramble over the tracks into the woods on the other side, all but VOSS. He is picking up as many of the notes and letters as he can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Andrejs, for God's sake!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slowly crosses the tracks, and disappears into the brush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BRUSH, TRACKSIDE - NIGHT 128 VOSS, overwhelmed with emotion sits down, examining the letters and notes in his hand. JANUSZ hurries back for him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! But VOSS doesn't move. JANUSZ sits beside him, and VOSS passes him a sample of the prisoners' pathetic messages - some scrawled on the back of photographs. They are mostly names and addresses, pleas for someone to mail or inform relatives of what happened to them - some have even clipped a few bank-notes to pay for postage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RUSSO-MONGOLIAN BORDER, COUNTRYSIDE - DAWN 130 Tall striped posts at intervals, strung with rusted wire - beyond, a dirt road and distant fields. From a concealed position in the nearby trees they carefully watch for signs of a patrol. JANUSZ goes first, passing easily through the sagging fence. ZORAN calls to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's it like in Mongolia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holds up a hand - 'Keep your voice down'. ZORAN crawls through the wire followed by the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love Mongolia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love it later. We need to get as far from this border as possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: faces Russia and as if bowing at the end of a performance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you Mother Russia for your hospitality! I definitely will not be coming back! It's only then that we notice that VALKA has not crossed through. He stands staring at them from the Soviet side. It's clear he's going no further. JANUSZ crosses back to him, and they talk through the wire. (CONTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll catch you if you stay, you know that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prison is o.k. Debt is bad. But there are many prisons. They don't find me. They stand a moment, watching the others moving toward a line of trees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, America?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not for me - 'Freedom'. Wouldn't know what to do with it, I swear to God. He places his hand on the wooden hilt of his knife, sticking out of his waistband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we must say goodbye, my Wolf and me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: glances at the knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need him any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck, Valka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck, Pakhan. And he turns and walks away. JANUSZ walks toward the distant group and by the time he looks back, VALKA is gone. 131 EXT. MONGOLIAN STEPPE - DAY 131 A vast plain stretches to distant snow-capped peaks. Dotted on the hills the Gers - circular tent-like structures, home to the nomadic Mongolians. In the distance walk the band of survivors, strung out in a line abreast. Their voices drift back - snatches of conversation., and laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD - DAY 133 The travellers striding confidently down the dirt road. Around a bend, a decorative archway over the road, a town visible a few miles further on. They stop in their tracks. On one side of the timber structure a portrait of Josef Stalin. On the other the local Mongolian leader, a red star on his military cap. In the centre, the hammer and sickle over a painting of a brown hand shaking a white one. Small flags of both nations flap ominously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the stunned faces of the fugitives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's here too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This changes everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at the grassy plains all about them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nowhere to hide.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MONGOLIAN STEPPE, LATER - DAY A136 The group walk toward a distant line of hills, feeling very exposed to any watching eyes. ZORAN How far is China? JANUSZ Five, six hundred kilometers. ZORAN groans. IRENA Is China free? SMITH There's a war on with the Japanese, I know that much. VOSS After China is Tibet. Religious people. Buddhists. (CNNTTNTTFD )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A136 JANUSZ But isn't Tibet closed to foreigners? I remember reading that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their religion would compel them to shelter us. We could go to Lhasa, the capital.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We break out of one 'closed country' and now we plan to break into another? I like 'open' countries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and JANUSZ exchange a few excited words in Polish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: translates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say we could go beyond Tibet. Over the mountains. To India.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What mountains?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes his head) The Himalayas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could join the British Army. First fight Nazis then Russians!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go over the Himalayas? How? On a magic carpet? A silence as they contemplate the massive distances stretching ahead of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ABANDONED STONE BUILDING, MONGOLIA - DAWN AB136 In the middle of an empty plain a small circular stone ruin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RUIN - DAWN 136 Sleeping figures. A gentle tip-tapping sound. VOSS opens his eyes. Staring back at him from the doorway, half a dozen sheep. He nudges TOMASZ who wakes sleepily, takes his eye-line. Carefully, slowly, they rise, VOSS drawing his deer-bone knife. Then they move. The sheep retreat, bumping into each other, and outside the chase is on. TOMASZ tackles a ewe and VOSS approaches with a knife, but JANUSZ is behind him, grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Andrejs, no!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tries to free his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't kill it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not? We're hungry!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want the locals after us too? They break into Polish, a blazing argument, months of pent up frustration. VOSS picks up the sheep and carries it inside the ruin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RUIN, LATER - DAY 137 Milk squirting into their aluminium bowl as VOSS expertly milks the ewe, IRENA and ZORAN holding it steady.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STEPPE - DAY 138 The sun is blazing as they cross through a sea of grass, hills rising in the distance like islands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and ZORAN play a long distance walker's game - each in turn kicking a rock out ahead, continually passing it from one to the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SMITH look to the hills surrounding them as they walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You feel it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feel what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're being watched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: uneasy, squints in the direction of the hills. And you can feel it. Like a John Ford western there's a sense of being in Indian territory, of their every move watched by unseen eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUDDHIST TEMPLE - DAY A139 A distant view of a temple complex at the base of low hills. AB139 EXT. STEPPE - DAY AB139 The above has been pointed out by VOSS to the group, and they decide to make their way to the temple, in the hope of getting food. 139 EXT. ABANDONED TEMPLE COMPLEX, STEPPES - DAY 139 Within a walled compound they wander between a series of recently abandoned Buddhist temples and out-buildings. By the size of the compound, several hundred monks may have lived here. Everywhere are signs of violence - doors hang from hinges, and a large statue of Buddha lies smashed in a courtyard. JANUSZ points to a line of bullet impacts, stitched across a wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TEMPLE - DAY 140 There are bloodstains on the floor, and the wind howling about the building makes a haunting accompaniment. IRENA and VOSS are alone inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same as happened in Russia. Churches closed, priests shot or taken to camps, religion banned. They came to my church, in Latvia. Destroyed everything, declared it a 'museum'. Later that night, there was a lone guard. A boy. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I strangled him until his eyes popped right out of his head. Valka knew somehow. Knew I'd killed in cold blood. He bows his head. IRENA looks up at him, and they stand together in silence, but for the moaning wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MONGOLIAN STEPPE - DAY 141 As they head South, each is lost in their own thoughts when seemingly out of nowhere a half-dozen Mongolian horsemen are galloping toward them. The horsemen circle them, far from friendly looks on their faces. They wear the traditional costume of Steppe nomads and range in age from a man in his seventies down to a six-year-old boy. The OLD MAN pulls up his horse in front of SMITH, figuring as he's the oldest he'll also be the leader. The groups stare at each other. The OLD MAN speaks in Russian, a rough guttural accent. [THE FOLLOWING DIALOGUE IS IN RUSSIAN.]
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Russki? A glance between SMITH and JANUSZ. Much may hang on his answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. American. The OLD MAN maybe doesn't get the 'American' part, but he gets that they are not Russian. He seems pleased about that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lhasa?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lhasa. Yes. Tibet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: points South.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pilgrim?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No horses? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are too poor to have horses. The OLD MAN points at IRENA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wife?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at IRENA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves closer to him. SMITH puts a protective arm about her shoulder. The OLD MAN considers the situation for a moment longer before abruptly turning, and followed by his band, galloping off toward the distant hills. Looks between the group, not exactly of relief, as there's a feeling it may not be the last they see of the riders. IRENA looks up at SMITH, smiles at him. Something about him calling her his daughter has touched some hidden place. SMITH, a little embarrassed, smiles back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER'S EDGE, MONGOLIA - DAY 142 While SMITH fishes in the river, others tend to their battered feet. VOSS passes around deer fat in his improvised deer skull container. This they rub over raw patches, and between their toes where deep cracks have developed. JANUSZ repairs their footwear, while TOMASZ sits by the fire sketching IRENA. ZORAN, the camp barber, trims hairs and beards
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE - DAWN 143 TOMASZ is smoking fish over the fire as the group stir. He gives ZORAN a kick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you do that for? I was in the middle of this beautiful dream - just about to eat some salt, I could already taste it. I want to go back to that dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STEPPES, MONGOLIA, LATER - DAY 144 The figures seen walking away in the distance. Floating back the voice of TOMASZ giving a recipe of a favorite Polish dish to ZORAN. ( CONTTNTTFT) )
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then add two sprigs of rosemary and a pinch of nutmeg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nutmeg? What about the salt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll get to that. Now, add the oil and leave it to marinate, while you prepare the chicken. That's where the salt comes in...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rub it into the skin of the chicken with a little of the paprika.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Double the salt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't just double the salt! It'll be too salty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care, just do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to ruin it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A CHANGING LANDSCAPE, MONGOLIA - DAY 145 A primaeval and austerely beautiful landscape stretches before them. Tufty knolls of dry grass are the only detail that break up the flat immensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY 146 Up ahead of them on the edge of a ridge a lone Mongolian horseman watches them approach. He's the young boy from the group of horseman who originally approached them. They pause before him. He looks at them a moment then tosses a goatskin bag at their feet before galloping off in the direction from which they came. VOSS picks up the skin bag, gives it a shake. Water. They continue on to the edge of the ridge and a view of a vast desert plain is revealed. (CONTINUED) Revised 3/16/09 (Salmon) 84.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look back to the disappearing horseman before scrambling down the rocky slope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI DESERT - DAY A147 The group crossing into the heart of the Gobi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI DESERT, LATER - DAY 147 VOSS is the first to see it - a vast glittering lake. They hurry toward it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lake leads them on, but appears no closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has taken a reading of the sun, using his stick method. He points out their direction - it is away from the beckoning lake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janusz!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates, looks at VOSS who holds up their water- bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT'D.) (CONT'D) We should go to the lake. Water is getting low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What lake? It's a mirage. He plods on, away from the shimmering vision. There's little the others can do but trust JANUSZ, and slowly they follow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE GOBI - MIDDAY/DUSK 150 The sun is directly above, the land shimmering with heat The group have stuck their sticks in the ground and draped their jackets over them, making a sunshade they
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: under. Revised 3/16/09 (Salmon) 85.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun has dropped, casting shadows. JANUSZ rises from the shelter and calls for the others to continue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE GOBI - ANOTHER DAY 152 The figures, tiny in the surrounding desert, walk on,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the lead needing to constantly slow down to allow the others to catch up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE GOBI - SAME DAY A153 The group hesitate on hearing a distant roaring sound up ahead. Nothing on the horizon. Then they are hit by a fierce wind, as toward them rolls a vast cloud of sand. They drop to the ground instinctively, and huddled together throw blankets around their shoulders and over their heads, as they are engulfed in the choking sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: they emerge from their own 'dune', and shaking themselves down they resume their journey southward. 153 EXT. THE GOBI - NIGHT 153 The temperature has dropped to freezing and they huddle by a fire, picking sand out of their small ration of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm too tired to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not keep walking?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm for that, if we can wake Andrejs. They look to where VOSS sleeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can sleep anywhere, any time. How does he do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you plot your way by the stars? (CONTTNTTFD ) Revised 3/16/09 (Salmon) 85A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Nods.) Yes, but haven't you noticed? He points upward to the low clouds obscuring the stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see any. I'm trying to remember my school geography but I seem to recall the Gobi Desert somewhere in Southern Mongolia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins scooping out a hole in the pebbly ground. It's funnel-shaped, narrow at the base. The others watch as he lines the sides with dried deerskin, placing their cooking pot in the base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We may pick up a little morning dew. Glad of something practical to do they all set about digging and lining holes with anything to hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE GOBI - DAWN 154 As they wake, they harvest the precious droplets of water caught overnight, trickling the contents into their pot, barely a quarter cupful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI - DAY 155 No-one has slept much and they walk like zombies, strung out in a line, no-one speaking, all just dully concentrating on placing one foot after the other. ZORAN notices VOSS, walking behind him is actually asleep. He has swung his backpack onto his chest and with his head resting on it he is actually sleep-walking. ZORAN tests his theory by walking away from the group, in a small circle. VOSS follows, guided by the sound of ZORAN's footsteps. He wakes him, VOSS looking around with a start.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were asleep!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No I wasn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were following the sound of my footsteps - sleep-walking. The others have stopped. ZORAN takes the backpack from
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and places it on the exhausted IRENA. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just follow the sound of my footsteps. She nods, not fully understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put all else out of your mind, and sleep. I'll wake you in Calcutta. She smiles, nods, already half asleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI, LATER - DAY 156 ZORAN looks over his shoulder, smiles proudly as he sees
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is sleep-walking, trusting to the steady sound of his footsteps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI MID-DAY 157 The group rest under the meagre shade provided by their coats. SMITH walks away from them, and crests a slight rise. From here he has a clear view to the horizon. Off in the distance a dark patch against the light sand. Through the dancing mid-day light he sees shapes. Trees? He staggers back to the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janusz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: follows him to the rise. SMITH points to his discovery. JANUSZ squints against the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's another mirage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shakes his head 'no'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have no more water. I see trees. Where there's trees there's water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's East. We must head South. The others have joined them, staring toward the distant shape. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never doubted you, Janusz. Not once. But we must give it a try.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We must keep going South! You'll kill us all!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn it, we're already dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: goes to move on, SMITH grabs his shirt sleeve, a short pathetic struggle sees them fall to their knees,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and TOMASZ move to separate them. SMITH is the first to stand, brushing sand and dirt from his clothes. He turns to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have a choice. He looks at IRENA, then turns and goes back for his staff and jacket. The others watch as he turns East toward his discovery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a mirage. Just a mirage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: keeps walking away - a strange echo of the incident in Siberia when he walked away from the guards. Perhaps it is this memory that causes the others to turn silently, and collecting their few possessions, to follow him. JANUSZ watches a while, then slowly follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE GOBI - DAY 158 Close on SMITH as he squints against the glare. His point of view:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE DISTANT OUTLINE OF TREES SEEMS TO DISAPPEAR IN THE SHIMMERING WAVES OF LIQUID HEAT

direction.raw_text: ? THE DISTANT OUTLINE OF TREES SEEMS TO DISAPPEAR IN THE SHIMMERING WAVES OF LIQUID HEAT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 159 Close on TOMASZ as he stares ahead of him. His point of
direction.name: direction

result.heading: NOW, BUT STILL IT WEAVES, APPEARING AND REAPPEARING IN THE HEAT-SHIMMERS

direction.raw_text: R NOW, BUT STILL IT WEAVES, APPEARING AND REAPPEARING IN THE HEAT-SHIMMERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 160 Close on ZORAN. His point of view:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A BIRD RISES INTO THE SKY FROM THE NOW MORE SOLID TREES

direction.raw_text: R AGAIN. A BIRD RISES INTO THE SKY FROM THE NOW MORE SOLID TREES. Back on ZORAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mirages don't have birds! Wider, and they're running, running with the last of their precious energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WELL - DAY 161 A clump of straggly tortured trees surround a desert well - a low square of ancient stones. They sprawl by the well, SMITH reaching down inside with their bowl to bring up a scoop of crystal clear water. It's passed around rapidly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a little. Don't fill yourselves. More scoops follow in quick succession, enough to splash hands and faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calls from a few yards away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fire. Coals are still warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and JANUSZ join him, examining the ground about the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lots of tracks. Nomads?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe others will come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over here! The remains of a meal! There's still meat on the bones! He points to the cooked remains of some animal. Using VOSS's deer-bone knife he scrapes meat from the bones, others just attacking any bone they find. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't eat it all! He manages to save at least half of the meat, wrapping it in a cloth, and putting it in VOSS's backpack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WELL, LATER - DAY 162 They lie stretched out under the shade of the trees dozing, and every now and then going back to the well to drink or just to lay their hands in the cool water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPFIRE - NIGHT 163 IRENA sleeps while the men discuss their situation in hushed tones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least we have water here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But no food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other nomads will come. Water their flocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When? Next week? Next month?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We could wait a few days, at least.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without food, we'll only get weaker. Maybe too weak to travel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These last days - I don't know that I could go through that again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks at the water) It was a miracle finding this. Can we count on another?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say we stay. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look to SMITH. He looks up to find them watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you looking at me for? Ask Janusz. He's already made up his mind for us, haven't you, Janusz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .WELL - DAWN 164 They all take a last drink from the well, then pour water over their faces and clothes. VOSS fills the skin water- bag, then ZORAN fills their cooking bowl to the brim. Steamis rising from their damp clothing when they set off. ZORAN walking on tip-toe, anxiousnot to spill a dropfrom the bowl in his outstretchedhand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .GOBI DESERT - DAY 165 Close on TOMASZ as he looks back over his shoulder to
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE WELL, STILL NOT MORE THAN 500 YARDS BEHIND

direction.raw_text: : 166 Close on ZORAN as he too turns for a last look at:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE WELL, NOW UP TO HALF A MILE BEHIND AND LOOKING LESS REAL IN THE SHIMMERING HEAT

direction.raw_text: : 167 Close on VOSS, he shades his eyes to see:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE WELL IS BELOW THE HORIZON NOW, AND ALL THAT CAN BE SEEN IS THE ENDLESS FLATNESS, THE SAME EMPTINESS THAT STRETCHES OUT BEFORE THEM

direction.raw_text: . GOBI, DESERT - TIMELAPSE - DAY 168 They walk in a desert void. There are no features, no distant hills, no growth of any kind. It is an emptiness, the only sound that of their footsteps and their labored breathing. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the while their water supply is dwindling - water from ZORAN's bowl long gone, the goat-skin water-bag no longer sloshes, but has to be squeezed to get out even a mouthful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI - DUSK 169 JANUSZ hands out small portions of the scavenged meat from the waterhole. All of them are subject to cramps, the result of the lack of water, and from time to time they are seen reacting to a sudden bolt of pain, attempting to stretch against it, or massage the limb out of its paralysis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - NIGHT 170 SMITH and JANUSZ collect more dried camel dung for the fire. SMITH looks to where the others sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know that, but they mustn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can survive a month or more without food, but water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Days?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe two days, maybe less in this heat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about what we're getting from condensation?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the only thing keeping us alive. But for how long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you get us back to the waterhole? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI - LATER - DAY 172 As they walk VOSS picks up a pebble, holds it up to show
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who walks behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When we worked the fields, during the hot summers, we used to suck on small stones like these. Don't know why but it made us feel less thirsty. ZORANpicks up a pebble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've eaten just about everything else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't eat it, just suck on it. At this moment IRENA falls again, her knees buckling and her face pitching into the sand in almost one movement. They turn her over again, wiping the sand from her nose and mouth. SMITH makes a shelter over her with their sticks and jackets. She lies with her eyes closed, her breathing coming in harsh gasps. Both legs are now swollen to the knees. He touches the swelling and the marks his fingers make remain for some seconds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sunstroke?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wakes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm becoming a nuisance. She looks down at her legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do they hurt you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not at all. They must be swelling because I've walked so far. Don't you think, Mister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods reassuringly then quickly turns away, a look of deep anguish passing across his face. 95.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI - NIGHT 173 The others keep watch over her as she sleeps. SMITH passes around a splash of water in the cup. They all refuse it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Save it for Irena. We've got our pebbles. And he pops one in his mouth, makes out it's delicious and soothing. In the now familiar ritual they scoop out holes in the sand, lining them with their jackets, hopeful of collecting a little moisture overnight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI - DAWN 174 They walk on, ZORAN carefully carrying the partly filled bowl of water. IRENA seems refreshed, but JANUSZ and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walk beside her, watching her every step.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can walk alright if I can lean a little on you. They each lightly lay a hand on her elbow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI - LATER - DAY 175 IRENA starts to fall forward, they steady her, and she walks on for a bit before slumping forward, and falling to her knees. SMITH too falls with exhaustion. VOSS hurries back to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you go on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so. But what about Mr. Smith?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: struggling for breath is back on his feet, waving them on. VOSS and JANUSZ each put an arm about her and half-carrying, half-dragging her, they set off again but it's no use, she's lost all her strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to carry her. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GOBI DESERT - DAY 178 A lizard, in close up, listens to an approaching sound. As the volume builds he runs for his life. A beetle too, has heard it and burrows into the sand as a foot in a battered moccasin looms large in frame. We follow the foot a few staggering steps, then a blur, as a body falls through frame, ending in a close-up of TOMASZ, his breath coming in short gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WIDER, GOBI DESERT - DAY 179 The five figures, small in frame, TOMASZ the last in line, down on his knees. He raises a hand, hasn't the strength to call out. Then one of the figures sees him, calls to the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on TOMASZ. He pulls the leg of his trousers up with difficulty - the tell-tale swelling of the ankles, just as with IRENA. As
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: approaches he quickly covers his legs and staggers to his feet. JANUSZ steadies him, and taking his arm they continue.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BASE OF THE GREAT DUNE, GOBI

direction.raw_text: . DUNES, GOBI DESERT - DAY 180 As they walk the landscape changes from the endless scrubby plain to sweeping sand dunes. The nature of the terrain makes the going slower and they move forward on the edge of exhaustion. In a curious freak of Nature the wind whips across the top of the dunes creating an eerie singing sound. Ahead, and across their path a massive dune - no way forward but over it. TOMASZ looks up, staring in horror - TOMASZ'S HALLUCINATION: The dune is moving, rising up, higher and higher, like a massive sand wave. Back on TOMASZ. He collapses, unconscious. 181 EXT. BASE OF THE GREAT DUNE, GOBI - TWILIGHT 181 An eerie, ghostly twilight, the group all sitting together in a rough circle around TOMASZ. He seems to revive as he passes around sketches he's made during their imprisonment and escape. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's an almost cheerful scene, like a traveller showing happy snaps taken on holiday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like this one. When did you do that? He holds up a sketch of KAZIK, showing him examining one of his battered shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the train. Poor Kazik, always the trouble with his feet. ZORAN holds up a drawing of himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at it again genuinely shocked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father maybe, but is that how I look now? A chuckle from the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at a sketch of IRENA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You caught her smile. SMITH passes the sketch to JANUSZ as TOMASZ lays back down, a smile on his face. He looks up at the stars. He knows he's dying and has accepted the fact. This in turn has given strength to his friends, and between them all is a feeling of love and a kind of peace.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BASE OF THE GREAT DUNE, GOBI

direction.raw_text: . BASE OF THE GREAT DUNE, GOBI - DAWN 182 They've tied his pencil to a length of hide, and hung it from the top of the cross over his grave. A faint breath of morning breeze sets it swinging like a pendulum, the others long gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUNES - DAY 183 As they stagger on JANUSZ has moved well out in front, when he stumbles and falls. Then he sees it, just out ahead, and he begins crawling toward it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JANUSZ'S MIRAGE - DAY: It's the hedge and gate from his vision. Behind the hedge the hint of a roof. Through the gate can be seen the path to the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUNES - DAY 184 JANUSZ crawling faster now, when ZORAN appears beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you see it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Jan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But do you see it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. He helps him to his feet and they continue on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUNES, GOBI DESERT - DAY 185 In the glare of the noon-day sun they shelter under their coats propped on their walking staffs. No-one speaks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUNES, GOBI DESERT - DAY 186 SMITH and JANUSZ support each other as they stagger on. SMITH's eyes are on the ground, following the dancing shadows before him. JANUSZ nudges him, points - above them two magnificent eagles, the source of the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eagles live in mountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks at the featureless landscape ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They also fly long distances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LANDSCAPE, MONGOLIA - DAY 187 The dunes are more intermittent here, the ground more stony and undulating. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VOSS hears it first, and with his remaining strength moves out of the circle of firelight into the desert. He pauses, listens again. A scraping sound. Then he sees them coming out of the gloom - JANUSZ dragging an unconscious SMITH by his shoulders. VOSS hurries to them. A look from JANUSZ - 'water'? VOSS shakes his head, 'No'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE - SAME - DAWN 190 A black snake, thick as your wrist, slides over ZORAN'S leg. He stares, too close to death to feel fear. He's not even entirely sure it's real. He watches its progress as it slithers up the rocky hillside. Then he gets it, and he's up, running on pure adrenaline, following after the snake, leaving his sleeping companions by the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HILLSIDE - BRIEF MONTAGE - DAY 191 ZORAN tracking the snake. He mutters to himself in a kind of delirium. He is crawling after the snake, scraping skin from knees and elbows. The snake disappears down into a rocky defile, followed by ZORAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE - DAY 192 SMITH in a death-like sleep. A distance away VOSS and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stand, staring upward at the waving figure some fifty metres up the hill. A native? Black mud obscures his face. It's ZORAN. He waves, dances about, then in a cracked voice, a single word drifts down to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VALLEY FLOOR - DAY 193 ZORAN, JANUSZ, VOSS - lie flat out like lizards, their faces in damp, black mud. Sucking sounds. They slurp at small pools of water, split lips, puffed and bleeding. At first, just to swallow is painful, but it is life. After each mouthful there is a moment they must wait as the seepage re-fills the little hollows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MUD-POOLS - LATER - DAY 194 They've carried SMITH to the water and JANUSZ supports him in a sitting position while VOSS and ZORAN, in turn, soak their shirts in the mud, dripping the life-giving liquid into SMITH'S mouth. He coughs, splutters, as he sucks at the moisture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER PART OF THE VALLEY - DAY 195 A black snake protruding about a foot out of a hole in the sandy soil. ZORAN points, and is joined by JANUSZ and VOSS. JANUSZ holds his hand up for them to go very still. He speaks in a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knife .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: passes him the deer-bone knife. With it, he splits the end of his staff, to make a fork out of the end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if it's poisonous?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can still eat it. Just cut off its head. He passes the knife to VOSS, then creeps toward the creature, and striking quickly he attempts to trap the snake in the fork. Too slow. The snake disappears into its hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VALLEY - LATER - DAY 196 Like snake-fishermen, they sit waiting bythe snake-hole - ZORAN too, has a snake-catching stick. Then they see a second snake, slithering across the rocks. At a signal they strike, ZORAN deftly trapping the snake's head in the cleft stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .CAMPSITE, VALLEY - DAY 197 Chunksofwhitish snake meat are cooking on a thin flat stoneovera fire of twigs and grass. The men grab piecesofthe snake and eat, nodding approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not bad. (CONTINUED) Revised 2/25/09 (Pink) 103.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JANUSZ helps SMITH sit up, feeding him a small piece of meat. SMITH waves him away, sinking back to the ground too tired to eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kind of like chicken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, a long black poisonous chicken with no legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Valka talked of eating each other? In Siberia?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did? Would you have eaten me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Probably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would never have eaten you - too stringy and bitter, I'd rather eat snake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nearly chokes on something, reaches into his mouth, pulls out a tooth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scurvy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE - NIGHT 199 The fire burns low, VOSS and ZORAN sleep. SMITH wakes from time to time and JANUSZ forces him to eat and drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is deathly pale, his life ebbing away. He speaks in short, croaky stabs, every breath an effort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can kill you, remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Kindness'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tries to force more water on him but SMITH waives him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long can you survive on snakes and mud? You should leave me, but you can't can you? You're a fool. I'd leave you. He lays back down. JANUSZ studies his face, pain and suffering etched in sharp lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mightn't know youur first name, but I know your son's name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irena told you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I say his name? Nothing from SMITH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'David'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saying his name on't bring him back. He struggles onto his elbow, staring intently at JANUSZ, an ironic smile on his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You trying to give me the will to live? That it? Stop me giving up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you giving up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the camps, some saw death as 'freedom'. (CONTINUED) Revised 3/16/09 ( Salmon) 105.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why didn't you kill yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Survival was a kind of protest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: makes him take a little water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now being alive is my punishment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Punishment for what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brought David to Russia didn't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And no-one can forgive you? And you can't forgive yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be easier if I had religion, or a home to go back to, like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For us, the old life is gone. They sit in silence for a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irena told me they tortured your wife and she informed on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They did that to my boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My wife was released, that much I know. She lived, but like you she won't be able to forgive herself. Only I can do that. He leans closer to SMITH, speaks just above a whisper, his voice intense, his eyes burning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'll torture herself for what she did. Just like you. That's why I have to get back! (CONTTNTTFT) 1 106.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This last, has impressed SMITH, and despite his death- wish a flicker of life surges through his bones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE, MUD-FLAT - DAWN 200 Next morning, and the figures of the four men are seen in wide-shot sleeping by the embers of their fire. One figure gets up, picks up his staff, and begins to walk slowly South, toward the distant mountains. It's SMITH. The others stir, their attention caught by the sight of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staggering onward. JANUSZ knows what the effort to walk is costing him, and he knows this is SMITH's gift to him. They hurriedly pack up, VOSS cramming the back-pack with roasted snake-meat, ZORAN collecting a last bowl of water, which he pours carefully into their goatskin water- bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DESERT - DAY 201 JANUSZ catches up with SMITH, giving him his arm in support, and together they slowly continue their journey Southward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CHANGING TERRAIN - DAY 202 They leave the desert behind as they climb gently rising ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY 203 The survivors each seen alone as they experience the life- giving water: one simply lets water run though his fingers; another submerges himself entirely; one drinks, savoring every mouthful as if it were the finest vintage wine. SMITH fishes. Beside him several of his catch gleam silver in the light. 204 - OMIT 205 EXT. HILLSIDE - DUSK/NIGHT 205 Walking abreast they head toward a pass between two massive mountains - in the distance gleaming snow-capped peaks rise even higher. 107.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAMPSITE, MOUNTAINS - DAWN 206 They sleep, huddled together amongst the stony rubble. It is snowing. VOSS is the first to rise. He looks about him in disbelief, shakes the others awake, pointing. Just beyond where they've slept a high wall towers above them. In this extreme Western section it's in poor shape - not built of stone, but of ancient mud bricks, tumbled down in many places, but to the East the outline is distinct as it straggles over ridges to the horizon - the Great Wall of China.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE GREAT WALL, CHINA - DAY 207 They enter through a keyhole-like opening formed by collapsed masonry, now dressed in their cold weather clothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SKY - DAY 208 From high above a series of aerial shots take us over a massive snow covered mountain range. 209 EXT. SNOWY LANDSCAPE, TIBET - DAY 209 The men climb steadily up snow-covered hills, pausing at a cairn of stones covered with tiny flags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tibetan? They move on with renewed energy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . COUNTRYSIDE, TIBET - DAY 210 CLOSE on the deeply lined face of a SHEPHERD. He wears Tibetan costume and squints his eyes as he stares into the distance. From his P.O.V., four distant figures walking across the snowy plain toward him. The sound of dogs barking.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A RIDGE NEAR THE SHEPHERD'S HUT

direction.raw_text: . A RIDGE NEAR THE SHEPHERD'S HUT - DUSK 211 Far below in a valley lies the legendary Lhasa - the stepped palace and surrounding town burnished by the last of the golden light. A sprinkling of lights come on as the shadows lengthen. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Above and beyond, like a massive wall, rise the snow- capped peaks of the Himalayas. This has been theview stretching out before the four fugitives andtheirtour- guide, the old shepherd. As if pointing outthechoice confronting them, he labels each of these spectacular features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lhasa LHA-SA! Then, indicating 'over' the mountains -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: IN-DI-A! In dumb-show, he mines that the mountains would be very cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SHEPHERD'S HUT - NIGHT 212 Three horses arrive at the door of the lonely hut and its associated outbuildings. THE SHEPHERD dismounts and with much bowing opens the door for two other Tibetans who follow. One is a LPMA, the other a local OFFICIAL. They stoop as they enter - a glimpse inside to where the four survivors sit at a table, surrounded by bowls and plates of food. 213 INT. SHEPHERD'S HUT - NIGHT 213 The LAMA and the OFFICIAL sit opposite the group. Tea is served. The official speaks English with difficulty, and as in Mongolia, he addresses the elder of the group - MR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: India? Yes. There is the track to Sikkim, over the mountains. Many people go there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And food?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small villages there. They give food. Wood for fire. Yes, but you don't go now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on JANUSZ, intensely following the conversation. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why can't we go now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If big snow come - very difficult. You wait here until Spring. This family keep you. He confers with the LAMA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's three months.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indicates the LAMA) He go to Lhasa. Get permission for to stay. Only to Spring. Not possible foreigners stay Tibet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: bows his head, mutters thanks, all of the group doing likewise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STABLES, SHEPHERD'S HUT - NIGHT 214 THE SHEPHERD has seen JANUSZ, ZORAN and VOSS to their quarters. He passes VOSS a battered oil-lamp and retires with much bowing. They settle on the straw covered floor, laying out their heavy wool fleeces and blankets given to them by the shepherd's wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we can't cross in Winter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said it was 'difficult'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes in, and they make room for him in the cramped space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to sleep 'till Spring. Like a bear in a cave. What about you, Mister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: settles with his back to the wall, draws up his sheepskin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to Lhasa. The others are stunned by this. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Lama has a contact - maybe get me out through China. There's a U.S. military mission there. They don't like it. A feeling he's deserting them, breaking up the team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Looking after number one.' Isn't that what Americans say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoran?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eventually looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We escaped. We made it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blows out the lamp. Silvery moonlight from a small window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right. I just realized it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Realized what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apart from a few mountains, we're there. We made it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not all of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not all of us. Their thoughts drift back to their lost companions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will you do, Mister? When you get home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Home'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Build metros?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Might drift for a while. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haven't you had enough of that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on JANUSZ, hardly listening, his thoughts elsewhere. Their late-night conversation drifts over him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will fight. First Germans, then Russians.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then re-build your church?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will die fighting. This statement has an oddly prophetic sound. JANUSZ look across at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to get Tomasz's pictures to a newspaper, or get them published somehow. Then I'm going to cook his chicken - but with extra salt just to annoy him. Chuckles from the group. SMITH And you, Janusz? VOSS (TO SMITH) As long as the Communists are in Poland, he can't go back. ZORAN They'd shoot you wouldn't they, Janusz? They settle down to sleep, outside the wind is picking up. JANUSZ I'll just keep on going. Until it's over. Keep on walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks through the gloom to where JANUSZ sits - moonlight slashes the side of his face, but he can't quite see his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on JANUSZ. He's wide awake. No thought of sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 215 - OMIT 216 INT. STABLES - DAWN 216 ZORAN and VOSS agitated at the discovery that JANUSZ has gone. Much coming and going in and out of the hut, checking that he isn't somewhere close by. Only SMITH remains undisturbed as he sits with his back against the wall, the ghost of a smile on his lips. He expected nothing less. 217 EXT. HIMALAYAS - DAY 217 Up ahead a figure, JANUSZ, dwarfed by the mountain chain, struggles on, climbing toward the snow-capped passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIGHER PASS DAY 218 As he climbs he hears a cry, mingling with that of the wind - a voice echoing about the mountains. He ignores it for a few paces, before he looks back - far below two figures waving and calling - VOSS and ZORAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOUNTAIN SLOPE/VALLEY, TIBET/INDIA - DAWN 219 The change from the barren mountains of Tibet, to the lush green of Sikkim is abrupt and startling - from rocky upper reaches the slope to the valley becomes rich in scrubby birch-woods, rhododendrons, and deciduous forest, until finally it becomes dense rain forest. It is with a backdrop of this luxuriant green that Indian faces look up toward the slopes. Here they watch three wild looking bearded men descending toward them. The additional cost of this final leg of their journey is plainly visible on their faces, and in their slow stumbling movements. They walk like automatons, only their senses fully alive. Shouts from the locals produce a village ELDER, then a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Older children squeal with delight, while some of the very young cry out in fear, one even bursting into tears - are these the dreaded Yeti their grandfathers told them lived up in the mountain peaks?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VALLEY PATH, INDIA - DAY 220 Close on JANUSZ, VOSS, and ZORAN as the beaming POLICEMAN escorts them past dozens of smiling faces. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This being India, a small crowd of the curious rapidly swells, until the path is lined two and three deep on either side, like a welcoming crowd at the end of a marathon. Small children are held up for a better look, while hands reach out patting their backs and shoulders - it's as if they know these men have achieved something remarkable. Close on JANUSZ, as amongst the sound of the gathering crowd other voices join in, cheering voices, hundreds of them, rising in volume until the cheering changes into that of a chant, now seemingly swelled by thousands of voices. Still CLOSE on JANUSZ walking as behind him the Indian scene dissolves into a series of black and white images. (Throughout, the image of JANUSZ walking is from this scene in India). - VICTORY IN EUROPE. CROWDS CELEBRATE IN TRAFALGAR SQUARE... SUPER, 'V.E. DAY, 1945' JANUSZ walking. - FIGHTING IN BUDAPEST, THE UPRISING AGAINST THE COMMUNIST GOVERNMENT... SUPER, 'HUNGARIAN UPRISING, 1956' JANUSZ walking. - THE BERLIN WALL BEING BUILT, SOME ATTEMPT ESCAPE. A MAN IS SHOT AS HE CLIMBS THE WALL... SUPER, 'BERLIN WALL, 1961' JANUSZ walking. - RUSSIAN TANKS IN PRAGUE, CONFRONT DEMONSTRATORS...SUPER, 'PRAGUE UPRISING, 1968' JANUSZ walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A HOUSE, POLAND - DAY 221 The camera moves toward a gate in a hedge. The click of the latch as it opens. A downward view of the flagstones. The front door, the camera pans left. The loose brick. A hand into frame removes a key from behind the brick. Into the lock of the door, the door pushed open.
